page.title: 02THE VILLAGES IN BRIEF
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF HALE HAS FEW AMENIT- IES.THERE ARE NO SHOPS AND NO PUBS.THE CHURCH IS NOT EASILY ACCESSIBLE AND THE PRIMARY SCHOOL FORMS THE FOCAL POINT OF THE VILLAGE. HALE HOUSE,BUILT IN 1715 AND STANDING IN HALE PARK ,IS OPENED TO THE PUBLIC ON SEVERAL DAYS EACH YEAR. THE VILLAGE HAS ITS OWN CHURCH AND CEMETERY. THERE IS A SMALL BUT THRIVING RIDING STABLES, THE SURROUNDING COUNTRYSIDE BEING IDEAL FOR TREKKING. WOODGREEN HAS A CHURCH,A CHAPEL,A CEMETERY,TWO SHOPS AND A PUB.THERE IS ALSO A PLANT TECHNOLOGY CENTRE. THE EXTREME NORTH OF THE BLOCK LIES OVER THE BORDER,IN WILTSHIRE. HERE THERE IS A SHOP, A SOCIAL CLUB AND A PLAYING FIELD. ALSO JUST OVER THE BORDER, IN THE DOWNTON AREA,THERE IS A SMALL BRICKWORKS.
